sen.j: 江原 素六（えばら そろく、天保13年1月29日 (旧暦)(1842年3月10日) - 大正11年（1922年）5月19日）は、旧幕臣、日本の政治家、教育者、キリスト者。
sen.e: Soroku Ebara (born January 29, 1842; died May 19, 1922) was a former retainer of the shogun who subsequently became a Japanese statesman and educator, as well as a Christian.

sen.j: 房楊枝作りを手内職とする貧しい家庭に育ち、辛苦を舐めながらの生活であったが、剣術、洋学を学び、講武所の教授方として取り立てられる。
sen.e: He was raised in an nimpoverished family who made toothpicks to supplement their income, and though he experienced hardship, he was able to study swordsmanship and Western studies, and was appointed as an instructor at Kobusho.

sen.j: 鳥羽伏見の戦いでは、人材不足の幕府側の指揮官として戦ったことが認められ、江戸城開城後も市川・船橋戦争などで新政府軍と戦うも負傷して戦線を離脱する。
sen.e: As the bakufu was short of manpower at the Battle of Toba and Fushimi, he was appointed as a commander, and even after the fall of Edo Castle, he fought the army of the new government at Ichikawa, Funabashi and the like, eventually being injured and withdrawing from the battlefront.

sen.j: 明治維新後に勝海舟の執り成しで罪を許されて沼津市へ移り住み、旧幕臣の子女への教育の為、沼津兵学校、駿東女学校（現・静岡県立沼津西高等学校）設立に尽力するとともに、東京に麻布学園を創設。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, he was pardoned thanks to the good offices of Kaishu KATSU, and relocated to Numazu, and in order to educate the children of former retainers of the bakufu, he made exhaustive efforts to establish the heigakko (Numazu officer academy), Sunto school for girls (present day West Numazu High School, Shizuoka Prefecture), as well as the Azabu Gakuen in Tokyo.

sen.j: 沼津では、旧幕臣の授産事業として、愛鷹山官林の払い下げ運動や茶の輸出会社の設立などを行った。
sen.e: In Numazu, under a work program established for former retainers of the bakufu, he established a company for exporting tea, conducting forestry management and the like on Mt. Ashitaka, and so on.

sen.e: Several days after he embarked on a school trip in his capacity as principal the the junior high school he established in Azabu, taking his students to Hakone, he died of cerebral apoplexy at the age of 80.
